benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Happy-path tag creation scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03) and related checks (TC04, TC05).
Duplicate Submission: Duplicates are handled (TC13) and idempotent behavior verified (TC20).
Large Payloads: Handling of large payloads and heavy-load scenario (TC19, TC14).

Validation: Extensive input validation coverage including invalid item IDs (TC07), non-existent items (TC08), malformed body (TC09), empty tag list (TC10), invalid/unsupported tag definitions (TC11, TC12, TC24).
Authorization/Headers: Missing header (TC06) and unauthorized access (TC16) covered.
Not Found / Missing Resources: Non-existent item (TC08) and no-data scenario (TC15).
Dependencies and service availability: KillBill service down (TC17) and tag-definition service down (TC21).
Timeout/Performance: Heavy load test (TC14) and timeout scenario (TC25).
State variation: Partially populated database (TC22) and maximum tags scenario (TC23).
Integration/Dependency scenarios: Dependency on tag definition service (TC21).
gaps: 500 Internal Server Error: No explicit test for a generic 500 Internal Server Error scenario.
Rate Limiting: No tests cover rate limiting or throttling for POST requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) for POST responses.
403 Forbidden path: Only 401 (unauthorized) tested; a 403 scenario for insufficient permissions could be added.
recommendations: Add a test for 500 Internal Server Error to cover unexpected server failures.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests for POST /tags to ensure proper handling under load.
Add tests for caching headers where applicable (ETag, Cache-Control) to verify caching behavior.
Include a 403 Forbidden test path to cover insufficient permissions beyond missing/invalid credentials.
Consider explicit idempotence-focused tests (re-sending the same valid payload) to ensure consistent results on repeated submissions.
